title: Introducing the Black Diaspora
xlist: Same As: AFAM S261, section 01
yc_attrs: This course can be applied towards the Humanities and Arts Yale College distributional requirement.
description: Critical survey of political moments and cultural expressions of African and African descended people since the social, cultural, and political upheavals of the 1970âs. The contours of Black diaspora politics and erotics will be explored. Key discourses, practices, movements, and theorizations of Black public culture will be covered by confronting a range of local sites/events/texts in Africa, the Caribbean, Europe, Latin America, but mostly in the US and UK. These will highlight issues of performance and style; pleasure/joy; representation; gender; sexuality; race; and class. Interdisciplinary assignments are drawn from across various academic and aesthetic disciplines, ethnography, cultural criticism, and everyday life. 1 Credit. Tuition: $3,600. Session B: July 6 - August 7.
